endpoints.name: Search For Orders
endpoints.description: Search for orders using a customerOrderId.

queryParameters.name: Customer Order Id
queryParameters.description: The customer’s ID that is associated with the order.

queryParameters.name: Delivery Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a single delivery of a message associated with the order. You can use readDeliveries to return deliveryId as part of the deliveryObject.

queryParameters.name: Message Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a single message associated with the order. You can use readMessages to return messageId as part of the messageObject.

queryParameters.name: Contact Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a contact associated with the order. You can use readContacts or readContactsWithLatestUnsubscribeDate to return contactId as part of the contactObject.

endpoints.name: Get Order
endpoints.description: Use an order ID to retrieve the details of an order. This request returns multiple representations of an order’s state via the “states” and “status” fields. The “status” field is currently deprecated and it is recommended that you use the “states” field going forward.

pathParameters.name: Order Id
pathParameters.description: The unique identifier for an order.

queryParameters.name: Delivery Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a single delivery of a message associated with the order. You can use readDeliveries to return deliveryId as part of the deliveryObject.

queryParameters.name: Message Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a single message associated with the order. You can use readMessages to return messageId as part of the messageObject.

queryParameters.name: Contact Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a contact associated with the order. You can use readContacts or readContactsWithLatestUnsubscribeDate to return contactId as part of the contactObject.

endpoints.name: Search For Carts
endpoints.description: Search for carts using a customerCartId.

pathParameters.name: Customer Cart Id
pathParameters.description: The customer’s ID that is associated with the cart.

queryParameters.name: Delivery Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a single delivery of a message associated with the order. You can use readDeliveries to return deliveryId as part of the deliveryObject.

queryParameters.name: Message Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a single message associated with the order. You can use readMessages to return messageId as part of the messageObject.

queryParameters.name: Contact Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a contact associated with the order. You can use readContacts or readContactsWithLatestUnsubscribeDate to return contactId as part of the contactObject.

endpoints.name: Get Cart
endpoints.description: View the contents of a cart using a cart’s ID.

pathParameters.name: Cart Id
pathParameters.description: The unique identifier of the cart.

queryParameters.name: Delivery Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a single delivery of a message associated with the order. You can use readDeliveries to return deliveryId as part of the deliveryObject.

queryParameters.name: Message Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a single message associated with the order. You can use readMessages to return messageId as part of the messageObject.

queryParameters.name: Contact Id
queryParameters.description: The unique identifier for a contact associated with the order. You can use readContacts or readContactsWithLatestUnsubscribeDate to return contactId as part of the contactObject.

endpoints.name: Get Products
endpoints.description: This returns the complete set of data stored in Bronto for each product matching the given Product IDs in the call. If none of the listed products are found, a 404 is returned.

queryParameters.name: Product Ids
queryParameters.description: A list of the Product IDs you want to get data for Example: /products/public/products?productIds=X&productIds=X .

queryParameters.name: Field Names
queryParameters.description: You can filter the data that is returned by specifying which product fields you want to get information about. The list of valid fields can be found on the Product Fields page in the BMP. If you do not include any fieldNames then all of the data for the product is returned.

endpoints.name: Get Product
endpoints.description: The products GET function where an individual product id is included returns the complete set of data stored in Bronto for the product matching the given product id in the function call. If it is not found, a 404 error code is returned..

queryParameters.name: Field Names
queryParameters.description: You can filter the data that is returned by specifying which product fields you want to get information about. The list of valid fields can be found on the Product Fields page in the BMP. If you do not include any fieldNames then all of the data for the product is returned.

endpoints.name: Get Campaigns
endpoints.description: This returns a list of campaigns.

queryParameters.name: Sort
queryParameters.description: Sort results by field. Possible values: id,created,modified,type,name.

queryParameters.name: Order
queryParameters.description: The order that results will be displayed in, either ascending or descending.

queryParameters.name: Search
queryParameters.description: Search for a campaign by name. You must enter the entire campaign name.

queryParameters.name: Archived
queryParameters.description: Limit results to archived campaigns.

endpoints.name: Get Campaign
endpoints.description: Use a campaign ID to retrieve the details of an individual campaign.

endpoints.name: Get Campaigns Types
endpoints.description: This returns a list of all available campaign types.

operations.name: Add Order
operations.description: Allows you to add a new order. This request accepts both representations of an order’s state via the “states” and “status” fields. Updates to either field will be reflected in the other. The “status” field is currently deprecated and it is recommended that you use the “states” field going forward. If both “status” and “states” are both specified, the data supplied in “status” will be used.

operations.name: Update Order
operations.description: Update an existing order using the Bronto-generated order ID. If you want to update an order using the order ID generated by your system, use Update Order By Customer Order Id. Properties that are not included in the request body will remain unchanged on the existing order. No properties are required in the update.

operations.name: Update Order By Customer Order Id
operations.description: Updates an existing order using the customerOrderID. The customerOrderID is an ID generated outside of Bronto, typically by your system. If you want to update an order using the Bronto-generated order ID, use Update Order instead.

operations.name: Delete Order
operations.description: Delete an order with the given Bronto-generated order id. If you want to update an order using the order ID generated by your system, use Delete Order By Customer Order Id instead.

operations.name: Delete Order By Customer Order Id
operations.description: Delete an order with the given customerOrderID. The customerOrderID is an ID generated outside of Bronto, typically by your system. If you want to delete an order using the Bronto-generated order ID, use Delete Order instead.

operations.name: Add Cart
operations.description: This call can be used to create a new cart. Only the customerCartId field and the quantity and totalPrice fields of all, if any, lineItems are strictly required.

operations.name: Update Cart
operations.description: Make an update to an existing cart. Properties that are not included in the request body will remain unchanged on the existing cart. No properties are required in the update.

operations.name: Fiddle Cart
operations.description: Fiddle a cart with the given id. When a cart is fiddled, the Bronto Marketing Platform is notified that the customer’s cart is still ACTIVE and will reset the cart activity timer used by Bronto’s cart abandonment feature. If the cart had previously been abandoned and the customer returns to the website, the fiddle will reset the cart’s status to ACTIVE.

operations.name: Abandon Cart
operations.description: Abandon a cart with the given ID. The cart must not be in the COMPLETE or EXPIRED status. This sets the cart’s status to ABANDONED.

operations.name: Expire Cart
operations.description: Expire a currently abandoned cart with the given ID. This sets the cart’s status to EXPIRED and will make the cart immutable. A cart can only be expired if its status is ABANDONED.

operations.name: Complete Cart
operations.description: Complete a cart with the given id. This sets the cart’s status to COMPLETED and will make the cart immutable.

operations.name: Update Products
operations.description: Allows synchronous batch updates to the products in your catalog. Accepts an array of product update entities, which must contain all the fields (field name : field value) in the product. Normal validation of the product field values will be applied, and individual products updates will be rejected if they fail validation. An array of String errors will be returned for each product that is not updated.

operations.name: Create Campaign
operations.description: The campaigns POST function allows you to create a new campaign with the supplied fields.

operations.name: Update Campaign
operations.description: The campaigns PUT function allows you to update a campaign with the supplied fields.
